testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0001. If the propertyBag resource is given as the input resource to the bash step then pipeline sync should success .
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0001. If the propertyBag resource is given as the input resource to the bash step then pipeline sync should success .

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0002. If the propertyBag resource is given as the output Resource To the bash step then pipeline sync should success .
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0002. If the propertyBag resource is given as the output Resource To the bash step then pipeline sync should success .

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests 1. User should be able to add new pipelineSources
testcase.classclass: 1. User should be able to add new pipelineSources

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests 2. User can get their resources
STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0003. Users should not be able to delete the resource if it is dependent on the bash step.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0003. Users should not be able to delete the resource if it is dependent on the bash step.

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests 3. User can delete pipelineSource by Id
testcase.classclass: 3. User can delete pipelineSource by Id

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0004. If User updates a value for a key-value pair in the propertyBag resource which is given as the output resource in Bash, then it should create a new version for that resource.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0004. If User updates a value for a key-value pair in the propertyBag resource which is given as the output resource in Bash, then it should create a new version for that resource.

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0005. If User updates the property(key-value pair) of the propertyBag resource which is given as the output resource in Bash, then it should create a new version for that resource.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0005. If User updates the property(key-value pair) of the propertyBag resource which is given as the output resource in Bash, then it should create a new version for that resource.

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0006.Users should be able to get all the properties in the configuration section of the propertyBag resource as an env variable in Bash step where each property is exported as “$key”.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0006.Users should be able to get all the properties in the configuration section of the propertyBag resource as an env variable in Bash step where each property is exported as “$key”.

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0007. User should be able to get all the properties in the configuration section of the propertyBag resource as an env variable in Bash step where each property is exported as “$res_resourceName_key”.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0007. User should be able to get all the properties in the configuration section of the propertyBag resource as an env variable in Bash step where each property is exported as “$res_resourceName_key”.

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0008. If the user uses “/ ” in the key of key- value pair which is under the configuration section of the propertyBag resource. This resource should be used as an input resource to the bash step. Verify if the user triggers the bash step, then the step should error out.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-propertyBag-0008. If the user uses “/ ” in the key of key- value pair which is under the configuration section of the propertyBag resource. This resource should be used as an input resource to the bash step. Verify if the user triggers the bash step, then the step should error out.

testcase.class: STEP_BASH_PROPERTYBAG - BashPropertyBag Step Tests S-Bash-propertyBag-0009.If the user uses “/ ” in the value of the key-value pair which is under the configuration section of the propertyBag resource. This resource should be used as an input resource to the bash step. Verify if the user triggers the bash step, then the step should success.
